city.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The nearest big city was St. Louis.
city.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a large town that has been given an official title by a king or queen
city.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a town of any size that has definite borders and powers that were officially given by the state government
city.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The city of Cleveland celebrated its 200th birthday with fireworks and an outdoor concert.
city.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the people who live in a city
city.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The city has been living in fear since last week’s earthquake.
city.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: They have stores in Houston, Dallas, and other big cities.
Cairo is one of the world's great cities.
He said that he never wanted to leave his home city.
San Francisco is a very cosmopolitan city.
Sheffield is an industrial city in the north of England.
There have been protests in the capital and in provincial cities.
Budapest is a beautiful and historic city.
He went to university in the cathedral city of Durham.
the old walled city of Alghero
Strasbourg is Leicester's twin city in France.
The hotel is in the city centre.
rural areas south of the city limits
In the summer, city dwellers escape to the sea.
Traffic was moving slowly along the city streets.
in the heart of a city
The cathedral is right in the heart of the city.
There were several bombings on the outskirts of the city.
He founded the city of Baghdad in the 8th century.
city.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: place with houses, shops, and offices
city
a large area with houses, shops, offices etc that is often the centre of government for an area. A city is bigger than a town
The nearest big city is San Francisco.
town
a large area with houses, shops, offices etc. A town is smaller than a city
La Coruña is a pretty seaside town.
capital
the city where the government of a country or state is
We travelled to Budapest, the capital of Hungary.
metropolis
a big busy city that is full of people and activity
After 1850 Paris grew quickly into a busy metropolis.
urban
relating to towns and cities
Air pollution is particularly bad in urban areas.
urban development
outside part of city
the outskirts
the area around the edge of a city or just outside it
Disneyland is on the outskirts of Paris.
suburb
an area around the edges of a city, where many people live
He lives in a suburb of London.
More and more people are moving to the suburbs.
city.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: an area in central London where there are many large banks and financial organizations, including the Bank of England and the stock exchange. The City has an area of about one square mile (about 2.5 square kilometres), and it is sometimes called ‘the Square Mile’, especially in newspapers. Its name is sometimes used to mean people who work there and make financial decisions. There is a similar area in New York City called Wall Street
city.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The City is optimistic about the outlook for inflation.
city.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: London’s financial institutions, for example the INTERNATIONAL STOCK EXCHANGE and other markets, banks, and insurance companies considered together as a financial centre
city.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The City will keep its position as a leading financial centre whether the UK joins the single currency or not.
city.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: the area of London where most financial institutions are based
city.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: The investment banking firm left the City for brand new premises in Canary Wharf.
